qas.question: Drug reps have been accused of giving what to health professionals?
Drug marketers have hired who as paid consultants?
What publications can drug ads be commonly found?
What have drug reps been accused of giving to conferences?
Conferences have hired who as paid consultants?
What publications can advisory boards be commonly found in?
Who has been accused of influencing consultants?

context: There has been increasing controversy surrounding <b7_0>pharmaceutical marketing and influence<b7_0/>. There have been accusations and findings of influence on doctors and other health professionals through <b6_0>drug reps<b6_0/>, including the constant provision of marketing <a0_0><b3_0>'gifts' and biased information<b3_0/><a0_0/> to health professionals; highly prevalent advertising in <a2_0><b5_0>journals and conferences<b5_0/><a2_0/>; funding independent healthcare organizations and health promotion campaigns; lobbying physicians and politicians (more than any other industry in the US); sponsorship of medical schools or nurse training; sponsorship of continuing educational events, with influence on the curriculum; and hiring <a1_0><b4_0>physicians<b4_0/><a1_0/> as paid consultants on medical advisory boards.
